title: What's News: World-Wide — WSJ
text:
This article is being republished as part of our daily reproduction of WSJ.com articles that also appeared in the U.S. print edition of The Wall Street Journal (September 26, 2019).

Trump asked his Ukrainian counterpart to "look into" Biden and his son and said he would direct his personal lawyer and Attorney General Barr to help him in a possible investigation, according to a document released by the White House.

The president and his re-election campaign expressed confidence that an impeachment effort would boost his bid for a second term.

Israel's president tapped Netanyahu to form the next government, giving the incumbent a lifeline as he tries to keep his hold on power.

Rouhani said that Iran would engage in no new negotiations with the U.S. until Washington lifts its economic sanctions.

The U.K.'s Johnson urged opposition parties to pass a no-confidence motion in his own government and spur an election.

A U.N. panel concluded that oceans are warming and ice sheets are shrinking because of heat-trapping greenhouse-gas emissions.

Beijing is increasingly tapping private Chinese firms to acquire foreign technology for its military, according to officials and a new report.

The average total cost of employer-provided health coverage passed $20,000 for a family plan this year, according to a new survey.

The Trump administration and the Honduran government signed an accord on asylum seekers.

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

September 26, 2019 02:47 ET (06:47 GMT)
